contribute.title: Contribute
contribute.description: FeyNote is a small project we made to fulfill our TTRPG needs. We want to make the platform accessible to anyone, but we also need your support. We only charge for features that are costly for us to host.
contribute.tier1.forever: Quill Bearer (No End Date) -- a special thank you
contribute.tier2.forever: Inkling (No End Date) -- a special thank you
contribute.tier3.forever: Tome Keeper (No End Date) -- a special thank you
contribute.free.description: Always free! We aim to always make the core features of the app free to use, but we appreciate any support you can give.
contribute.free.capabilities4: Live sharing and collaboration with your friends
contribute.free.capabilities5: Graph view, tree view, and dashboard
contribute.tier1.description: You are a hand that helps hold the grand quill! With your help we can keep the project alive and our community growing. Thank you for your selfless act of patronage.
contribute.tier2.description: One who doesn't just hold the quill but dwells in the ink it writes! You have our heartfelt gratitude for the above and beyond support.
contribute.tier3.description: Keeper of the books, watcher of the notes! We cherish your support and will do all we can to fulfill our promise of building a community driven note-taking application.

welcome.title: Welcome to FeyNote!
welcome.subtitle: To get started, here are a few things you can do:
welcome.docs.title: View the Documentation
welcome.docs.description: Learn how to use FeyNote and get the most out of your experience.
welcome.artifact.title: Create a Document
welcome.artifact.description: Documents are the building blocks of your world, consisting of text, calendars, or maps.
welcome.dashboard.title: View The Dashboard
welcome.dashboard.description: The dashboard is your home base for all of your content.
welcome.ai.title: Generate/Import Content
welcome.ai.description: The assistant can help you generate content or import content from any URL.
welcome.footer: You can always access this guide by clicking the welcome guide button on the settings page (in the left sidemenu)
import.title: Import Documents
import.file.error.type: Invalid file type selected. File must be of type(s);
import.file.error.size: File size limit exceeded. File must have a size of under;
export.title: Export Documents
export.options.json.instructions: References will be reserved as JSON properties.
export.options.markdown.instructions: Please note that block references will not be preserved in markdown exports.
exportToJson.title: Export To Json
exportToMarkdown.title: Export To Markdown
jobList.error.unknown: I'm sorry an unknown error has occurred, please try your upload again. If your problem persists please contact support.
importFromLogseq.title: Import from Logseq
importFromLogseq.instructions: Please select a zipped JSON export of your graph alongside your logseq assets directory if you wish to preserve images. (Note: Support for org mode is in-progress, and only documents of markdown format will be imported)
importFromLogseq.paragraph.start: Importing your files from Logseq can be done with the following steps;
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.one: 1. First open up logseq and find the ellipsis located in the top right corner of your application.
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.two: 2. Select the option from the dropdown menu called
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.three: 3. Select the "Export as Json" option from the popover that appears.
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.four: 4. Unfortunately the JSON export doesn't contain any images you might have attached to your notes, so next we need to head back to the ellipsis dropdown from step one and select
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.five: 5. Clicking that button will open up your system's file explorer and plant you somewhere within your
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.five.two: folder. To find your images, navigate to the base level of your Logseq folder.
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.six: 6. At the base level of your Logseq folder you'll see an
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.six.two: folder. Copy that folder out to wherever you've saved the exported json of your graph.
importFromLogseq.paragraph.step.seven: 7. Finally, now that we have both the assets folder and the exported graph, we want to zip the two of them togehter. Select both your assets folder and your graph, right-click and select the option to compress to zip.
importFromLogseq.paragraph.end: That's it! Your graph is now zipped up and ready to upload!
importFromObsidian.title: Import from Obsidian
importFromObsidian.instructions: Please select a zipped copy of your obsidian vault file.
importFromObsidian.paragraph.start: Importing your files from Obsidian can be done in a few simple steps;
importFromObsidian.paragraph.step.one: 1. First open up obsidian and find the ellipsis located in the top right corner of your application.
importFromObsidian.paragraph.step.two: 2. Select the option from the dropdown menu called
importFromObsidian.paragraph.step.three: 3. Clicking on that dropdown option will open up your system's file explorer and plant you somewhere within your
folder. Navigate outwards to where you can select this folder, right-click and select the option compress it to a zip.
importFromObsidian.paragraph.end: That's it! Your graph is now zipped up and ready to upload!

aiThread.card.format.query:
Format the following monster info into a stat sheet;
Shadow Wraith
Neutral Evil
Armor Class: 15
Hit Points: 84 (12d10 + 24)
Speed: 0 ft., fly 60 ft. (hover)
STR DEX CON INT WIS CHA
6 (-2) 20 (+5) 14 (+2) 1 (-5) 12 (+1) 16 (+3)
Skills: Stealth +10
Senses: Darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11
Languages: Understands Common but can't speak
Challenge: 7 (2,900 XP)

Life Drain (Recharge 5-6): The Shadow Wraith can drain the life force from a creature it touches. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 27 (6d8) necrotic damage, and the Shadow Wraith regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

Actions
Shadow Strike: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 5) necrotic damage.
aiThread.createMessage.error.rateLimit.m: Due to cost concerns and to prevent abuse we must limit the number of messages from our free tier subscribers. Your messaging limit will be reset in twenty-four hours.
template.welcome.title: Welcome to FeyNote!
template.welcome.p1: This document is intended to serve as a welcome and quickstart. For a complete guide to FeyNote, please visit
template.welcome.commands.p1: The command menu is one of the most important parts of FeyNote. To use the command menu, press the slash (/) key at the beginning of a line while editing text.
template.welcome.commands.p2: The command menu allows you to quickly add monsters, tables, spells, items, headings, and more. You can type after the slash character and the results will be filtered by what you type!
template.welcome.references.p1: One of the superpowers of FeyNote is it's ability to reference between documents. You can create a reference to another document by pressing the at (@) key anywhere while you're typing text -- the only requirement is that there be a space before the @ sign.
template.welcome.references.p2: Here's an example reference to another example document within your collection:
template.welcome.formatting.p1: FeyNote supports a variety of formatting options. Blocks can be inserted by using the command menu (/) mentioned above. Text formatting can be adjusted via the menu that will appear when selecting text.
template.welcome.formatting.p2: There are many quick shortcuts you can use to format text without opening the menu. If you're familiar with markdown, the following will be familiar to you.
template.welcome.formatting.p3: Italics can be added by ctrl+i or cmd+i, or by using _underscores around your text_.
template.welcome.formatting.p4: Bold can be added by ctrl+b or cmd+b, or by using **double star symbols around your text**.
template.welcome.formatting.p5: Strikethrough can be added by ctrl+shift+s or cmd+shift+s, or by using ~~double tildes around your text~~.
template.welcome.formatting.p6: Indentation/blocks can be added by using the tab key to indent, or the shift+tab key to outdent
template.welcome.formatting.p7: Headings can be added by using pound signs before your text at the beginning of a line. A single pound sign at the beginning of a line creates a heading 1, double pound signs at the beginning of a line creates a heading 2, and so-forth.
template.welcome.formatting.p8: Lists can be added by using a 1. or a - at the beginning of a line to create a numbered or bulleted list, respectively.
template.welcome.statblocks.p1: FeyNote has built-in support for stat blocks, spells, and several other decorative items. You can create a these by using the command menu (/) mentioned above, and selecting the monster, spell, or note options.
template.welcome.statblocks.example.trai: The monster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sniffing things out.
template.welcome.statblocks.example.acti: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
template.welcome.statblocks.p2: Additionally, you can insert things like spells in a similar fashion!
template.introducingReferences.title: Introducing References!
template.introducingReferences.p1: The power of FeyNote is in it's ability to reference between documents. You can create a reference to another document by pressing the at (@) key anywhere while you're typing text -- the only requirement is that there be a space before the @ sign.
template.introducingReferences.p2: The paragraph below is referenced by the welcome document:
template.introducingReferences.p3: If you update the text above, the welcome document will automatically update to reflect the changes. This is a powerful way to keep your content up-to-date and interconnected without managing it all yourself!
connectionStatus.online.help: You're online, and your content is cached locally. If you go offline, you can continue to edit your content.
You're online, but your browser does not support offline syncing. Using Firefox or Chrome will result in a faster, offline capable experience.
connectionStatus.offline.help: You're offline, but your changes will be synced to the server when you come back online as long as your browser is open.
connectionStatus.offline.syncUnavailable: You're offline. Your browser does not support offline syncing, so your changes will NOT BE SAVED. Using Firefox or Chrome will result in a faster, offline capable experience.
error.500: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again, and contact us if the issue persists.
generic.connectionError: There was a problem while connecting to the internet.
generic.unsavedChanges: You have unsaved changes! If you leave this page, you will lose any modifications in-progress.
